adventure_overview: Many Americans have a pet dog, cat, horse, bird, fish, hamster, or other animal. The most popular pet is a dog. Almost one out of three American households have a dog as a pet. One out of four have a cat as a pet. Pets are fun, but they are also a big responsibility. Pets need food, water, shelter, and exercise to stay healthy. When you look after a pet, whether it belongs to you or a neighbor, you learn a lot about love, loyalty, and caring. Learning to look after pets — and having fun with them — is what this Adventure is all about. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved.

requirements.text: Identify an animal that would be good pet for your family.

activities.name: My Pet
activities.description: Cub Scouts describe their pet or the pet they would like to have.

activities.name: Pet Savers
activities.description: Visit a local animal shelter and identify an animal that could make for a good family pet.

activities.name: Pets, So Many
activities.description: Cub Scouts explore what animal would make for a good family pet.

requirements.text: Choose two animals that are allowed as pets in your community.  Compare and contrast why these pets may be a good choice for you.

activities.name: Help Me Choose
activities.description: Cub Scouts compare and contrast two animals that are allowed in their community.

activities.name: Poster Pet
activities.description: Cub Scouts will choose two pets that are allowed in their community and create a compare and contrast chart.

activities.name: What Animal
activities.description: Cub Scouts choose an animal that is allowed in their community and present a charades-act of that animal.

requirements.text: Based on your choice in requirement 1, investigate how to properly care for your chosen animal.

activities.name: Pet Responsibilities
activities.description: Cub Scouts describe the responsibilities, care, and activities that are required for the family pet or an animal that would make for a good family pet.

activities.name: Shelter Visits
activities.description: Cub Scouts investigate how to properly care for pets by visiting an animal shelter.

activities.name: Trainer Visits
activities.description: Cub Scouts investigate how to properly care for pets by visiting with an animal trainer.

activities.name: Veterinarian Visits
activities.description: Cub Scouts investigate how to properly care for pets by visiting with a veterinarian.

requirements.text: Discover three ways a pet can help people.

activities.name: Animal Helpers
activities.description: Cub Scouts create a PowerPoint presentation showing three ways a pet can help people.

activities.name: Animal Partner
activities.description: Invite a professional who has an animal as a partner to discuss their partnership and roles.

activities.name: Service Animals
activities.description: Cub Scouts explore why service animals are important.
